page.title: 05Crowcombe V.A. School
page.content: Crowcombe school is a{voluntary aided {first school}catering for children between 5 and 9 years. The designation "V.A." signifies that the Church retains responsibility for the appointment of staff and for the maintenance of much of the fabric. It is a two teacher school with a { {pupil roll of 48}divided between{two {classrooms}(5-7 and 7-9 year olds). The present building was{erected in {1872}though the school was previously situated in church House. School begins each day at 9.15 a.m. and ends at 3.30 p.m. ,except on those days when an after school activity such as country dancing or cricket takes place. We have three breaks each day as follows: 10.45-11.00a.m., 12.30-1.30p.m. and 2.30-2.45p.m. The school day begins with worship.
